title: Learning Motivation Design and Application in Remote Education: Social Cognitive Model-Based Simulation/VR Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental mathematical concepts and experience using remote education platforms
context.additional_context: Analyzing motivational factors through mathematical problem-solving in simulation/VR environments and focusing on developing personalized instructional design strategies using sociocognitive theory

learning_goals: Learners can analyze motivational factors in remote education by applying a social cognitive model (self-efficacy, goal-setting, etc.).
Learners can apply at least three motivation-enhancing strategies when performing mathematical tasks in simulation/VR environments.
Learners can derive individual/group motivation profiles through learning motivation surveys and propose instructional design improvements based on them.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
